channel.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
channel.description:
Let's have a positive environment where questions can be asked about designs people come up with, the client, and other developments. We want to move forward this year so if you have some knowledge to contribute then answer a question, leave one of your own.
To start:
A lot of questions pop up about the updating protocol, what is the hardest part of implementing the updating protocol and what is your opinion about the most efficient ways to implement it?

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

stop reading my posts dammit

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Updating is pretty hard if you haven’t ever done it before because there isn’t a specific implementation. My favorite way of doing it is dispatching out events from an origin, intercepting them and then building an update list based on those events.

Read full topic

If you really want me to, I could try, but I can’t promise you’ll learn anything

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:75, topic:477432”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=595625.msg4405952#msg4405952 date=1391979273]

bumpppp this needs to come back

what is the correct way to handle player updating? im stumped

correct way would be to follow the protocol.
[/quote]
I don’t think you understand what I’m getting at

I’m asking like what would be the best way to tackle it. There are many different ways to take on player updating… all of which (have to) follow the protocol.[/quote]

Some ways are more efficient then others, but no implementation is the only correct one.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @Arrav Arrav
item.description:
@Arrav wrote:

Lol I’m not new exactly because I just haven’t used moparscape forums much. Infact I started out using moparscape client with all those barbarian assault hats floating around where fences should be lol. I just usually use rune-server more though because I dislike the normal SMF Themes. It would be great to have a more dark forum theme. ;3

Read full topic
item.source: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Arrav, post:65, topic:477432”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=595625.msg4193711#msg4193711 date=1357197293]
Hardest part IMO isn’t even the actual updating, it’s finding a smart way to store all of the variables that are used in player updating.
But then again, I’ve only tried doing it from scratch once and it was an awful experience.
[/quote]

Just make an Attribute System using a Map/Hashmap, and create an Object Array like this to set the default values:

public Object[][] defaultKeyValues = { {"Key1", "Value1"}, {"Key2", 1}, {"Key3", 1.0}, {"Key4", 0xFFFFFFL} };

^ Is an example for storing default values only. ^ Make the Map/Hashmap like this:

public Map<String, Object> variableSettings = new Hashmap<>();

Generics is a great way to store values, not perfect way, but bunches better than storing them with arrays and etc.

Also I did make a client quick command line-like design using the chat area that could be useful for near future scriptable commands, that I would like to work on, I have created the basic steps for it, and it works but I haven’t done scripting yet for scriptable commands, but heres the video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=92EK1qC48jI

Sorry if I am spamming, I am not meaning too, but I haven’t got used to moparscape and don’t know where to post exactly, so this topic gave me a great place to share.

Also, there is also another thing I would like to discuss, What is the Unknown byte in the Client -> Server packet of reporting another player? It seems to me like it is the flag of whether a player is supposed to be muted by moderator choice.[/quote]
we’ve been getting some great new members lately

Read full topic
item.source: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @Arrav Arrav
item.description:
@Arrav wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:2, topic:477432”]Hardest part IMO isn’t even the actual updating, it’s finding a smart way to store all of the variables that are used in player updating.
But then again, I’ve only tried doing it from scratch once and it was an awful experience.[/quote]

Just make an Attribute System using a Map/Hashmap, and create an Object Array like this to set the default values:

public Object[][] defaultKeyValues = { {"Key1", "Value1"}, {"Key2", 1}, {"Key3", 1.0}, {"Key4", 0xFFFFFFL} };

^ Is an example for storing default values only. ^ Make the Map/Hashmap like this:

public Map<String, Object> variableSettings = new Hashmap<>();

Generics is a great way to store values, not perfect way, but bunches better than storing them with arrays and etc.

Also I did make a client quick command line-like design using the chat area that could be useful for near future scriptable commands, that I would like to work on, I have created the basic steps for it, and it works but I haven’t done scripting yet for scriptable commands, but heres the video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=92EK1qC48jI

Sorry if I am spamming, I am not meaning too, but I haven’t got used to moparscape and don’t know where to post exactly, so this topic gave me a great place to share.

Also, there is also another thing I would like to discuss, What is the Unknown byte in the Client -> Server packet of reporting another player? It seems to me like it is the flag of whether a player is supposed to be muted by moderator choice.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:62, topic:477432”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=595625.msg4207007#msg4207007 date=1359071641]

upon login could you create a new client object (containing all i/o, and other stuff) and add it to a queue, then every say, 100ms have a thread that logs in the queue of clients?

[/quote]

Why create a new client object and queue clients every 100ms? Use connection pooling

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/jndi/tutorial/ldap/connect/pool.html[/quote]
thx 4 that

Read full topic
item.source: ITT: We ask questions and talk about technical RSPS stuff
